intro: Fimbristylis macgillivrayi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. This species typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and waterlogged soils. It has grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
